alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:55PM PST until January 15 at 2:03PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .Heavy rain along the south slopes of the Olympics and the Chehalis Valley has come to an end this afternoon. With the ground already saturated the Chehalis River at Porter will continue to rise and reach flood stage late this afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 47.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 48.8 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 900 PM PST.
